messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 103
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/14/2004 7:25:35 AM Central Standard Time, starsuncloud@netzero.net writes: My guys  are really neat too.:) They get it from their Dad I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/14/2004 7:25:35 AM Central Standard Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:

My guys are really neat too.:) They get it from their Dad I guess....
I was beginning to think I was the only one in a household of guys, without
pee around the toilet.
I guess most guys don't aim very well.



~~~

We're in the clean potty club, too. Although...if they're sleepy their aim
gets off sometimes. But they usually don't even raise the seat, then, either.

I always thought learning how to hit the water was part of toilet learning!

As for that other important issue, raising the seat...I never harped on mine
to put it back down. I figured if they could remember to put it up, I could
remember to put it down when it was my turn!

Karen


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 103
messages.msgSnippet: I don t understand...I have a guy, he sits to pee, and there is no more mess than when anyone else pees....Why is there a problem? My guys are really neat
messages.messageBody:
"I don't understand...I have a guy, he sits to pee, and
there is no more mess than when anyone else
pees....Why is there a problem?"

My guys are really neat too.:) They get it from their Dad I guess....
I was beginning to think I was the only one in a household of guys, without pee around the toilet.
I guess most guys don't aim very well.
Heck, even my three year old, who stands up to pee, hasn't missed yet. I guess they're weird. GOOD!

Ren
